item.title: Design Contest Presentations
item.description: Contents Slides Agenda and layout Slides No lecture/slides today. We‚Äôll have each group present their design contest presentations (10 minutes for each group). item.title: Multidimensional & Dimensionality Reduction
item.description: Contents Announcements Tweet of the day Slides: Lab: Text and t-SNE Announcements Quiz 2 will be available tomorrow morning. You have until 5:59pm, Monday October 21 to complete. Canvas link to Quiz 2 Tomorrow, RStudio Engineer Davis Vaughn (SpeakerDeck) will be presenting for the Charlotte RMeetup Group tomorrow from 12-1pm at CenterCity 1102. Remember, if you attend (must attend the full hour), per the Extra Credit Policy, you will receive 1% extra credit for attending.

item.title: Networks & Trees
item.description: Contents Announcements Tweet of the day Slides: Links: Lab: Networks & Trees Announcements Quiz 2 Problem Set 2 Design Contest next week and DataCamp 3 due in two weeks (Nov 5.) Tweet of the day New #shiny app! Something I've been playing around with for a while - a #dataviz of actors appearing in Wes Anderson films. Now interactive! Using the #wesanderson üé®üì¶ of course!

item.title: Distributions & Uncertainty
item.description: Contents Annoucements Tweet of the Day: Slides: Lab 5: Links: Annoucements DataCamp 2 is due by 11:59pm Tuesday, Sept 24th. Reminder that Problem Set 2 is due by 11:59pm Monday, Oct 7th (during Fall Break). Charlotte R Meetup Group. Possibly present on Tuesday, 12-1pm in 12/17 meeting. See Slack channel post. Tweet of the Day: My ??? talk is now in video form: A biased tour of the uncertainty visualization zoo.

item.title: Time & Space
item.description: Contents Announcements Tweet of the day Lab 4: Ch. 5 and Ch. 7 of Healy Slides Links: For deeper dives into time/spatial data Announcements Problem Set 1 is due tonight by 11:59pm Monday, Sept 16th. 50% penalty if turned in within 24 hours of deadline. 0% credit if turned in 24+ hours of deadline. Quiz 1 has closed. We will review answers in class. DataCamp 2 is due by 11:59pm Tuesday, Sept 24th.

item.title: Visual Representations II
item.description: Contents Tweet of the Day Announcements Slides Lab 3: Make a plot (ggplot2) Helpful Links Tweet of the Day üåü guide to visual encoding types from @tamaramunzner's "Visualization & Journalism" https://t.co/A2x96QYNoL #dataviz #infovis pic.twitter.com/2FIyXeWk4h — Mara Averick (@dataandme) October 17, 2018 Tamara Munzner is one of the most influential data visualization researchers. Her textbook ‚ÄúVisualization Analysis and Design‚Äù is one of the most popular data viz books and some of her former students are now leaders in data viz (e.

item.title: Visual Representations I
item.description: Contents Tweet of the day Announcements Slides Tweet of the day Visual encoding is itself a data transformation, often applied after a chain of other transformations. This is ‚Äúfirst week of class‚Äù, table stakes stuff. Sad if true that we don‚Äôt internalize this! ‚Äî Jeffrey Heer (@jeffrey_heer) August 11, 2018 Enrico Bertini is a data visualization researcher at NYU who co-hosts (with Moritz Stefaner) the podcast ‚ÄúData Stories‚Äù, which I highly recommend.

item.title: Introduction to Visual Analytics
item.description: Contents Tweet of the day: Slides & Lab Tweet of the day: Any time I have been struggling to learn a new tool/technology/software ‚Ä¶ I go back to this short clip I cut out of ???'s 2014 ??? tutorial on Dplyr to motivate myself to keep pushing through ‚Ä¶ learning new tools is hard for everyone at the beginning! pic.twitter.com/RevpkSJqWc ‚Äî Aliakbar Akbaritabar (Ali) (@Akbaritabar) July 25, 2018 Hadley Wickham is the R guru amongst gurus.

item.title: Python
item.description: a.sourceLine { display: inline-block; line-height: 1.25; } a.sourceLine { pointer-events: none; color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit; } a.sourceLine:empty { height: 1.2em; } .sourceCode { overflow: visible; } code.sourceCode { white-space: pre; position: relative; } div.sourceCode { margin: 1em 0; } pre.sourceCode { margin: 0; } @media screen { div.sourceCode { overflow: auto; } } @media print { code.sourceCode { white-space: pre-wrap; } a.sourceLine { text-indent: -1em; padding-left: 1em; } } pre.

item.title: Coordinated Multiple Views: Interacting & Brushing
item.description: Contents Tweet(s) of the day: Slides Hands-on Class Tweet(s) of the day: Announcing the Winners of the 1st Shiny Contest 136 submissions, 4 winners, 6 runners-up, and 21 honorable mentions. See some of the great work shared by the #shiny developer community. https://t.co/RJZbZbo2aY pic.twitter.com/EoaK440CQQ ‚Äî RStudio (@rstudio) April 5, 2019 üéâA first draft of my new book, ‚ÄúInteractive web-based data visualization with R, plotly, and shiny‚Äù, is now available!
